intro: Galium apricum, commonly known as false lily of the valley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium apricum produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
